ratings.comment: Horrible professor. Puts questions on exams we've never seen in lecture or in homework problems. Gave surprise quizzes at least once a week which sometimes were extremely hard and had nothing to do with the topics learned during that week. Sometimes the ta didn't even know how to solve the problems. AVOID THIS PROFESSOR IF POSSIBLE.

Fish is a super funny guy but is harder than heck to follow in class. Doesn’t speak the best English and focuses a lot on proofs rather than example probs. Expectations of class aren’t well defined. Class got frustrating at times but had an easy curve in the end. Tests can get really hard and he puts down probs more complicated than the examples.

He often had to stop in the middle of a lecture because he made a mistake.  He rarely was able to find his mistake and never came back to it so we were left with incorrect notes.  I never used lecture notes for homework or studying.   He is a good guy, just not a good teacher.

Prof. Fish missed 3 of the first 5 lectures.  The subs were organized and thorough.  NOT SO WITH FISH!  He went through proofs with his face in the book (the subs didn't even do that!).  Also, I have 3 main gripes: 1) he doesn't let students finish their question before he tells them they're wrong.  2) if a student proposes another way of proving s

although he progressed throughout the semester, i learned nothing from attending lecture. i am a math major and came out of the class with an ab midterms are semi difficult but doable.. the final was ridiculously difficult and we were extremely unprepared. he was hard to follow but a very nice guy

Im enrolled in the wes program so luckily im still getting a good grade in the class. no thanks to to AFish. i stopped going to lecture and just sleep in and teach myself from the book or on the internet. lectures are a waste of time
To be fair, I loathed the class, so my opinions are based on that. I got slapped in the face with mathematical theory. Was not enjoyable for me.

I got a 5 on the AP Calc test and love calculus. At Madison Calc 222 is the most failed class so, all of the classes will be hard. I attended all of the lectures throughout the semester (this is a waste of time as this professor is not meant to be a teacher). The only class I would recommend going to is the review day. Get a good TA or tutor.
sometimes hard to understand and one can easily get lost in his proofs which are quite useless come exam time. Exams are challenging but not over the top... easy B

A. Fish is a good guy and wants his students to learn.  Although Probability was a difficult course he tried to get everyone to learn.  Homework was hard but always helpful in office hours.  He gave practice questions for each exam and was generous in grading.  Study your notes and do a lot of problems on your own and you will do fine like me :)
He cannot really explain a concept in terms that a normal student can understand.

Confusing, moves at an extremely fast speed for the content. Has peculiar definitions of words like "easy" and "simple." Showed improvement throughout the year, so he might be better now. Homework is emphasized, so one's grade is dependent on the grading of the TA
